definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: No wonder his wife is penniless; he is always playing the horses and losing his money. (CDIP)
sentences.chinese: 難怪他妻子身無分文，他老是賭賽馬，把錢都輸光了。

sentences.english: He got quite cleaned out by gambling.
sentences.chinese: 因賭博他囊空如洗，身無分文。

sentences.english: As I was going through that period of financial scarcity, I prayed that I didn’t experience a cash windfall.
sentences.chinese: 在我身無分文的那段時間，我祈禱自己不會大發橫財。

sentences.english: Jane wanted to go to the movies but she was stone-broke.
sentences.chinese: 簡想去看電影，但她身無分文。

sentences.english: It would be a cashless journey through the land of the almighty dollar.
sentences.chinese: 那將是一次身無分文的在美元至上的土地上的旅行。

sentences.english: He impecunious is demoralized, be reduced to poverty does beggar to street.
sentences.chinese: 身無分文的他意志消沉，淪落到街頭做乞丐。

sentences.english: Many people would rather be penniless.
sentences.chinese: 很多人可能寧願身無分文也不願離開手機。

sentences.english: I committed to a year of cashless living.
sentences.chinese: 我決心過一年身無分文的日子。

sentences.english: They extorted every penny from us.
sentences.chinese: 他們把我們勒索得身無分文。

sentences.english: She was often penniless and regularly went hungry.
sentences.chinese: 她經常身無分文定期受餓。

sentences.english: He hasn't two sixpences to rattle together.
I was completely broke and didn't have the next month's rent anyway.
sentences.chinese: 我身無分文，本來也沒錢交下個月的房租。

sentences.english: He is aware he is impecunious suddenly, also did not carry certificate.
sentences.chinese: 他突然察覺自己身無分文，也沒帶證件。

sentences.english: Huo returned to Lanzhou penniless but couldn't stay.
sentences.chinese: 霍先生身無分文回到蘭州，但最終沒能呆下去。

sentences.english: They left Zimbabwe by car with almost nothing.
sentences.chinese: 當他們坐車離開辛巴威時簡直身無分文。

definition: no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on/without a friend in the world
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
to vanish/to disappear from the face of the earth
